newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Cisco, networking stocks fall.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Cisco, networking stocks fall.

text.p: Networking stocks fell in pre-opening trading after Cisco Systems posted second quarter earnings that matched Wall Street forecasts although revenues came in slightly weaker than expected.

Shares were trading at 79-3/4, traders said, below last night's closing price of 81-15/16. Other networking stocks also fell, with 3Com Corp at 54-3/8 from its close at 55-7/16 and Ascend Communications Inc at 52-1/8, down from its closing price of 53-3/16.
Cisco posted fourth quarter pro forma earnings of $0.55 a share versus $0.42 a share last year, in line with Wall Street estimates but also below the "whisper" number.

Another networking stock, Cabletron Systems Inc, had not yet traded. That company said it hired Don Reed, a senior executive at NYNEX Corp, as its new president and chief executive to replace retiring co-founder Robert Levine.
Boston Chicken Inc shares were nicked, moving to 12 from their close of 12-1/4 after the company said it expects "choppy" store performance and even lower-than-expected third quarter earnings.
Apple Computer Inc shares rose higher, to 20-5/8 from a closing price of 19-12/16, traders said, on rumors that Microsoft Corp would buy a $150 million stake in Apple Computer.
